member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.CollectionExtensions.BinarySearch``2(System.Collections.Generic.SortedList{``0,``1},``0,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Performs a binary search for the specified key on a . When no match exists, returns the nearest indices for interpolation/extrapolation purposes.
member.remarks: If an exact match exists, index1 == index2 == the index of the match. If an exact match is not found, index1 < index2. If the key is less than every key in the list, index1 is int.MinValue and index2 is 0. If it's greater than every key, index1 = last item index and index2 = int.MaxValue. Otherwise index1 and index2 are the indices of the items that would surround the key were it present in the list.
member.param: List to operate on.
The key to look for.
Receives the value of the first index (see remarks).
Receives the value of the second index (see remarks).

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.StreamExtensions.WriteInt32Optim(System.IO.Stream,System.Int32)
member.summary: Encodes a 32-bit signed integer in a variable number of bytes, using fewer bytes for values closer to zero.

remarks.para: Writes an integer 7 bits at a time. This allows small integers to be stored in 1 byte, longer ones in 2, at the cost of storing the longest ones in 5 bytes.
Note how an extra byte is needed in this example. This is similar to requiring a sign bit, however this way the positive values are directly compatible with unsigned Optim values.

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.StreamExtensions.WriteDecimalOptim(System.IO.Stream,System.Decimal)
member.summary: Encodes a decimal in a variable number of bytes, using fewer bytes for frequently-occurring low-precision values.

remarks.para: The first byte is a "header" byte. Its top bit indicates the sign of the value, while the remaining 7 bits encode the scale and the length, in bytes, of the mantissa component. Since the scale can be anything between 0..28 and the length can be up to 12, this number is simply an index into a lookup table which contains specific combinations of both values. These combinations were selected by analyzing the actual distribution of mantissa length + exponent pairs making a few assumptions about the likely inputs into arithmetic operations. The encoder makes sure to select a value representing the exact scale and the minimum representable mantissa length.
The result is always at most 13 bytes long, which is the same as discarding the three unused bytes of the raw representation.

member.summary: Word-wraps the current string to a specified width. Supports UNIX-style newlines and indented paragraphs.

remarks.para: The supplied text will be split into "paragraphs" at the newline characters. Every paragraph will begin on a new line in the word-wrapped output, indented by the same number of spaces as in the input. All subsequent lines belonging to that paragraph will also be indented by the same amount.
All multiple contiguous spaces will be replaced with a single space (except for the indentation).

member.param: Text to be word-wrapped.
The maximum number of characters permitted on a single line, not counting the end-of-line terminator.
The number of spaces to add to each line except the first of each paragraph, thus creating a hanging indentation.

member.name: M:RT.Util.Ut.WaitSharingVio(System.Action,System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan},System.Action)
member.summary: Executes the specified action. If the action results in a file sharing violation exception, the action will be repeatedly retried after a short delay (which increases after every failed attempt).
member.param: The action to be attempted and possibly retried.
Maximum amount of time to keep retrying for. When expired, any sharing violation exception will propagate to the caller of this method. Use null to retry indefinitely.
Action to execute when a sharing violation does occur (is called before the waiting).
